summary: Expand the multi-game hub app to include up to 50 games across varied categories/types (e.g., funny, hard, etc.).

existing_features.title: Create a home screen that functions as a multi-game hub, showing a grid/list of available games with name, short description, and a clear Play button for each game.
Implement at least 3 fully playable games in the app (client-side), each with clear rules/help, restart/new game controls, and an end state (win/lose/score).
Add user sign-in via Internet Identity and show signed-in state in the UI (e.g., header with login/logout and user principal/short ID).
Add per-game leaderboard UI that shows top scores and the current user’s best score (when logged in), and allow submitting a score at the end of a game.

Provide a coherent, creative visual theme for the whole app (colors, typography, spacing, components) and apply it consistently across hub, game screens, and leaderboards (avoid blue/purple as primary colors).
Add basic navigation structure (e.g., header + routes) for Hub, individual game pages, and an optional All Leaderboards page.
Add generated static images as app assets and use them in the UI (logo/brand mark and game category icons). Store them under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them from the frontend.

Expand the frontend game catalog to include up to 50 games by extending `frontend/src/gameRegistry.ts` with additional game entries (most can be marked as not yet playable) and ensure each game has a unique `id`, a clear English `title`, and a short English `description` that can reflect types such as “funny” or “hard”.

Update the game metadata model so the catalog can represent types like “funny” and “hard” without breaking existing pages. Add optional fields to `GameInfo` (e.g., `tags` and/or `difficulty`) and update the Hub, Game Shell, and All Leaderboards pages to display these fields when present.

Ensure the Hub UI remains usable with a large catalog (up to 50 games) by adding basic discovery controls on the hub screen: a text search (by title) and a category filter (using existing `category` values).
Add a lightweight runtime/dev validation for the registry to enforce the “maximum 50 games” constraint and prevent common configuration errors (e.g., length > 50, duplicate IDs).

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a games app that provides many different types of games (a multi-game hub)
Add backend support to record and retrieve high scores per game, associated with an authenticated user (Internet Identity principal).
Add support for a larger catalog of games (up to 50), spanning multiple categories/types (e.g., funny, hard, etc.).

projectName: Multi-game hub app with several playable games and leaderboards
